page.title: 14LOCAL EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Apart from the cement works and the petroleum storage depot, at the Wigmore Lane Industrial Complex, most of the employment available in this area is of an agricultural nature. Virtually all the land to the north and south of the Bath Road is owned by the Englefield Estate and a small percentage of the local population is employed by the Benyon family. However, most of the working population is employed outside the area, many commuting to Reading, or using Reading as a rail or motorway link for work in London. There is virtually no adult unemployment and little youth unemployment in the area.
